message: Let's start with a fair split, Bob. Accept and we can move on.
I'll take a slightly larger share, but we can still make this work.
That's still a bit too generous for Bob. I'd like to make a counteroffer.
Let's meet in the middle, Bob. A 50-50 split seems fair.
I'll give you a slightly smaller share, but I think I deserve more for taking on the risk of rejecting previous offers.
I'm not willing to give up 10% of the remaining value. I'll make a counteroffer.
I'm willing to give you a slightly smaller share, but I think I deserve more for being more aggressive in the negotiations.
I'm taking a firmer stance, Alice. I think I deserve a larger share for being more aggressive in the negotiations.
That's a pretty steep price to pay. I'll try to negotiate further.
I'm willing to give you a slightly larger share, but I think I deserve a bit more for being more flexible.
I'm not budging much, Alice. You'll have to make a stronger offer if you want me to accept.
That's a very tough pill to swallow. I'll try to make a stronger counteroffer, but I'm running out of options.
I'm getting desperate, Bob. This is my final offer. I'll give you a significant majority of the remaining value, but I need you to accept.
You're getting close to the end, Alice. I'm not backing down now. Take it or leave it.
I'm not willing to give up 80% of the remaining value. I'll try to make one last stand.
I'm making a last-ditch effort, Bob. I'll give you almost all of the remaining value, but I need you to accept this time.
It's now or never, Alice. I'm taking almost all of the remaining value. Accept this and we can end the game.
I suppose it's better than nothing. I'll accept your offer, Bob.
